data.source_sentence: 자화가 용이한 방향인 압연 방향으로는 우수한 BH 특성과 철손 특성을 가지지만, 압연의 수직 방향으로는 무방향성 강판보다 열등한 BH 특성과 철손 특성을 가진다.

data.source_sentence: 자기 스커미온(magnetic skyrmion)은 위상학적 솔리톤(topological soliton) 또는 위상학적 결함(topological defect)의 한 종류로 위상적으로 보호되고 준입자(quasi-particle)적인 성격을 지니는 카이럴 스핀 배열(chiral spin configuration)이 다.
data.mt_sentence: A magnetic skirmion is a type of topological soliton or topological defect, a chiral spin configuration that is topologically protected and has a quasi-particle nature.
data.target_sentence: A magnetic skyrmion is a type of topological soliton or topological defect, a chiral spin configuration with topologically protected and quasi-particle properties.

data.source_sentence: 스커미온에 대한 개념은 처음에는 영국의 물리학자인 T.H.R. Skyrme이 입자물리 분야에서 고안한 수학적인 모형이 었다.
data.mt_sentence: The concept of the skyrmion was initially a mathematical model devised by British physicist THR Skyrme in the field of particle physics.
data.target_sentence: The concept of the skyrmion was initially a mathematical model devised by the British physicist THRI3321 Skyrme in the field of particle physics.

data.source_sentence: 자성 물질에서 스커미온이 발견될 수 있다는 것은 1970년대에 2차원 하이젠베르크(Heisenberg) 격자 모형에서 예측되었다.
data.mt_sentence: It was predicted in the 1970s in the two-dimensional Heisenberg lattice model that skirmions could be found in magnetic materials.
data.target_sentence: In the 1970s, it was predicted in a two-dimensional Heisenberg lattice model that skirmions could be found in magnetic materials.

data.source_sentence: 여기서 자기 스커미온은 준안정(metastable) 상태나 솔리톤 상태로 존재하는 것을 가정했다.
data.mt_sentence: Here, it is assumed that the magnetic skyrmion exists in a metastable state or a soliton state.
data.target_sentence: Here, it is assumed that the magnetic skyrmion exists in a metastable state or a soliton state.

data.source_sentence: 이것은 하이젠베르크 교환 상호작용(Heisenberg exchangeinteraction)은 스핀을 균일하게 배열하는 역할을 해서 자기 스커미온과 같이 비균일한 스핀 배열이 에너지적으로 안정화되지 않기 때문이다.
data.mt_sentence: This is because the Heisenberg exchange interaction serves to uniformly arrange the spins, so that non-uniform spin arrangements such as magnetic skyrmions are not energetically stabilized.
data.target_sentence: This is because the Heisenberg exchange interaction arranges the spins uniformly so that non-uniform spin arrangements such as magnetic skyrmions are not energetically stable.

data.source_sentence: 안정된 스커미온을 형성하기 위해서는 다른 에너지의 기여가 필요하다.
data.mt_sentence: Contributions of other energies are required to form stable skirmions.
data.target_sentence: The contribution of other energies is required to form a stable skirmion.

data.source_sentence: DM 상호작용은 자기 스커미온을 안정시키는데 중요한 에너지 항이기 때문에 뒤에서 다루게 될 것이다.
data.mt_sentence: DM interaction will be discussed later because it is an important energy term for stabilizing the magnetic scumion.
data.target_sentence: The DM interaction will be discussed later as it is an important energy term for stabilizing magnetic skirmions.

data.source_sentence: 이론적으로 연구되던 자기 스커미온은 2009년 MnSi의 벌크 자성 재료에서 S. Mühlbauer와 동료 연구자들에 의해 최초로 관측된 이래, 다양한 자성 물질의 박막에서도 실험적으로 관측되고 있다.
data.mt_sentence: The theoretically studied magnetic skyrmion has been observed experimentally in thin films of various magnetic materials since it was first observed in 2009 by S. Mühlbauer and colleagues in bulk magnetic materials of MnSi.
data.target_sentence: The theoretically studied magnetic skyrmions have been observed experimentally in thin films of various magnetic materials since 2009 when S. Mühlbauer and colleagues first observed them in bulk magnetic materials of MnSi.

data.source_sentence: 스커미온은 응집 물질 분야에서 자성 물질뿐만 아니라 다강성(multiferroic) 물질, 강유전체(ferroelectric) 물질, 반도체 등에서도 발견되지만, 여기서는 자기 스커미온을 지칭할 것이다.
data.mt_sentence: Skirmions are found not only in magnetic materials in the field of condensed materials, but also in multiferroic materials, ferroelectric materials, semiconductors, etc., but will refer to magnetic skirmions here.
data.target_sentence: Skirmions are found not only in magnetic materials in the field of condensates, but also in polyferroelectrics, ferroelectrics, and semiconductors.

data.source_sentence: 스커미온의 정적 및 동적 거동은 위상학적인 특성을 보이는데, 이는 폰트랴긴 수(Pontryagin number) 혹은 스커미온수(skyrmion number)로 불리는 위상수(topological number)에 의해 특징지어질 수 있다.
data.mt_sentence: The static and dynamic behavior of the skyrmion exhibits topological properties, which can be characterized by a topological number called the Pontryagin number or skyrmion number.
data.target_sentence: The static and dynamic behavior of skirmions exhibits topological properties, which can be characterized by a number of phases called the fontriagine number or skirmion number.

data.source_sentence: 이 수는 2차원 실공간에 놓인 스커미온의 자화 배열을 역으로 극사영(inverse stereographic projection)시키는 방법을 통해 구형의 오더-파라미터 공간(order-parameter space)으로 매핑(mapping)했을 때, 자화가 구의 표면을 몇 번 감싸는지를 나타낸다.
data.mt_sentence: When this number is mapped into a spherical order-parameter space through inverse stereographic projection of the magnetization arrangement of the skyrmion placed in a two-dimensional real space, the magnetization It indicates how many times the surface of the sphere is wrapped.
data.target_sentence: When this number is mapped to a spherical order parametric space via an inverse projection of a skirmion's magnetization array placed in two-dimensional real space, the magnetization indicates how many times the surface of the sphere is wound.

data.source_sentence: Fig. 1(a), (b)와 같이 넬(Nèel)과 블로흐(Bloch) 스커미온의 자화는 오더-파라미터 공간에서 구를 한번 감싸고 Q = -1의 스커미온 수를 가지게 된다.
data.mt_sentence: As shown in Fig. 1(a) and (b), the magnetization of N)el and Bloch scumions wraps the sphere once in the order-parameter space and has a scumion number of Q=-1.
data.target_sentence: As shown in Figures 1(a) and (b), the magnetization of N)el and Bloch skirmions wraps around the sphere once in the order parameter space and the number of skirmions is Q=-1.

data.source_sentence: 음부호(-)는 스커미온 핵(core)의 자화 방향이 -mz를 가리키는 것을 나타낸다.
data.mt_sentence: A negative sign (-) indicates that the magnetization direction of the skyrmion core points to -mz.
data.target_sentence: A negative sign (-) indicates that the magnetization direction of the skirmion core points to -mz.

data.source_sentence: 스커미온 수는 다음과 같은 변환을 통해 보다 쉽게 결정될 수 있다.

data.source_sentence: 스커미온은 오랫동안 단지 2차원 객체 중 하나로만 여겨졌지만, 10여 년 전부터 고집적, 고속도, 저전력 특성을 가진 스핀트로닉스 응용소자에 대한 가능성이 열려 많은 주목받고 있다.

data.mt_sentence: Basic devices such as transistors and diodes are needed for devices using skirmions to function as information processing.
data.target_sentence: Basic elements such as transistors and diodes are required for devices using skirmions to perform information processing functions.

data.source_sentence: 2017년, AAA는 스핀파(spin wave)에 의해 구동되는 트랜지스터를 미소자기 전사모사(micromagnetic simulation)를 통해 보였다.
data.mt_sentence: In 2017, AAA showed a transistor driven by a spin wave through micromagnetic simulation.
data.target_sentence: In 2017, AAA introduced a transistor powered by spin waves through micromagnetic simulation.

data.source_sentence: 여기서 스핀파의 진폭과 주파수, 그리고 게이트 전압과 게이트 위치를 통해 구동 조건을 조정하면서 스커미온의 움직임을 제어하였다.
data.mt_sentence: Here, the movement of the skirmion was controlled by adjusting the driving conditions through the amplitude and frequency of the spin wave, and the gate voltage and gate position.
data.target_sentence: Here, the movement of the skirmion was controlled by controlling the driving conditions through the amplitude and frequency of the spin wave, the gate voltage and the gate position.

data.source_sentence: 2018년, AAA는 압전물질인 Pb(Zr,Ti)O3(PZT)를 이용해서 변형률(strain)에 따라 반강자성(antiferromagnetic) 스커미온이 넘나드는 에너지 장벽을 조절하여 기능하는 트랜지스터 소자를 미소자기 전산모사를 통해 보였다.

data.target_sentence: In 2018, AAA introduced a transistor device that functions by regulating the energy barrier traversed by antiferromagnetic skirmions according to the deformation of the piezoelectric material Pb(Zr,Ti)O3(PZT) through micromagnetic calculation.

data.source_sentence: 2021년, AAA는 Fig. 5(c)와 같이 나노 도선의 한쪽 면에만 노치(notch)부를 배치했을 때 스커미온이 한쪽 방향으로만 움직이는 현상을 이용해 다이오드를 제안하였다.

data.source_sentence: 근거리 신호 왜곡을 야기하는 변수 중에서 빔의 크기는 신호 왜곡에 기여를 하지 않으나, 빔의 크기가 커지면 두 축 간의 거리가 달라지기 때문에 그 기여도를 완전히 무시할 수 없다.
data.mt_sentence: Among the variables that cause short-range signal distortion, the size of the beam does not contribute to signal distortion, but as the size of the beam increases, the distance between the two axes changes, so the contribution cannot be completely ignored.
data.target_sentence: Among the variables that cause short-range signal distortion, the size of the beam does not contribute to signal distortion, but as the size of the beam increases, the distance between the two axes changes, so the contribution cannot be completely ignored.

data.source_sentence: 그림 1은 실제 사용 중인 라이다 시스템의 사양(표 1) 근처의 값을 이용하여 얻은 중첩함수(geometric overlap func-tion)의 모양을 나타낸다.
data.mt_sentence: Figure 1 shows the shape of the geometric overlap function obtained using values near the specifications (Table 1) of the LiDAR system in use.
data.target_sentence: Figure 1 shows the shape of the geometric superposition function obtained using values close to the specifications of the LiDAR system in use (Table 1).

data.source_sentence: 그림 1에서 알 수 있듯이 레이저의 발산각보다 망원경의 FOV를 크게 할수록 근거리까지의 중첩 함수가 빨리 일정값에 도달함을 알 수 있다.
data.mt_sentence: As illustrated in Fig. 1, it can be observed that as the FOV of the telescope is larger than the divergence angle of the laser, the superposition function up to a short distance reaches a certain value faster.
data.target_sentence: As shown in Figure 1, it can be seen that the larger the FOV of the telescope than the divergence angle of the laser, the faster the superposition function to the near field reaches a certain value.

data.source_sentence: 중첩함수가 1로 수렴하지 않는 것은 카세그레안 형태의 망원경에서 제2 반사경 마운트(직경 76 mm)가 전체 망원경의 면적(직경 100mm)의 특정 부분을 가리기 때문이다.
data.mt_sentence: The superposition function does not converge to 1 because, in the Cassegrean type telescope, the second reflector mount (diameter 76 mm) covers a specific part of the entire telescope area (diameter 100 mm).
data.target_sentence: In the Cassegrain telescope, the superposition function does not converge to 1 because the second reflector mount (76 mm diameter) covers a specific part of the entire telescope area (100 mm diameter).

data.source_sentence: 그림 1에서 알 수 있듯이 구축된 표 1의 사양에서는 라이다 신호가 약 1 km 이상까지 그 정보가 왜곡된다는 것을 알 수 있다.
data.mt_sentence: As can be seen in Figure 1, it can be seen that the information of the LiDAR signal is distorted by about 1 km or more in the constructed specification of Table 1.
data.target_sentence: As shown in Figure 1, it can be seen that the information of the LiDAR signal is distorted more than about 1 km from the configuration specifications in Table 1.

data.source_sentence: 1 km 이상에서도 꾸준히 변화를 보이고 있으나, 그 변화가 점진적으로 작아지기 때문에 실제 왜곡함수를 보정함에 있어서는 무한히 멀리까지 보정할 필요는 없다.
data.mt_sentence: Although it shows a steady change even at 1 km or more, it is not necessary to correct the actual distortion function infinitely far because the change gradually decreases.
data.target_sentence: Although it shows a constant change even over 1km, there is no need to correct the actual distortion function indefinitely because the change gradually decreases.

data.source_sentence: 라이다 신호는 근거리에서 점점 증가하다가 300 m 이하에서는 급격히 줄어드는 것을 볼 수 있고, 그와 달리 소산계수는 500 m부터 급격히 줄어든다는 것을 알 수 있다.
data.mt_sentence: It can be seen that the lidar signal gradually increases at a short distance and then rapidly decreases below 300 m, and on the contrary, the dissipation coefficient decreases rapidly from 500 m.
data.target_sentence: It can be seen that the lidar signal gradually increases at a short distance and then decreases rapidly below 300 m, while the dissipation coefficient decreases rapidly from 500 m.

data.source_sentence: 그림 2의 라이다 신호는 실제 이상적인 라이다 신호와 중첩함수의 곱으로 표시된 것이며 300 m 이후부터 중첩함수가 수렴한다는 의미는 아니다.
data.mt_sentence: The lidar signal in Figure 2 is represented by the product of the actual ideal lidar signal and the superposition function, which does not mean that the superposition function converges after 300 m.
data.target_sentence: The lidar signal in Figure 2 is actually the ideal lidar signal multiplied by the superposition function, which does not mean that the superposition function converges after 300 m.

data.source_sentence: 소산계수가 600 m 이후부터 점진적으로 감소하고 있으나, 실제 그 값은 어떤 시점부터 영향을 받았는지는 알 수 없으며, 그림 1과 표 1에 의하면 비교적 원거리부터 영향을 받는다는 것을 알 수 있다.
data.mt_sentence: The dissipation coefficient gradually decreases after 600 m, but it is not known when the dissipation coefficient is actually affected, and as illustrated in Fig. 1 and Table 1, it can be seen that it is affected from a relatively long distance.
data.target_sentence: The dissipation coefficient gradually decreases after 600 m, but it is not known when the dissipation coefficient is actually affected. As shown in Fig. 1 and Table 1, it can be seen that the influence is relatively distant.

data.source_sentence: 펄스형 라이다의 경우 근거리 소산계수는 설계의 사양에 따라 실제 값과 많이 차이가 날 수 있으며, 이용 시 이러한 오차 정보를 충분히 알고 있어야 하거나, 보정이 필요하다.
data.mt_sentence: In the case of pulsed LiDAR, the near-distance dissipation coefficient may differ a lot from the actual value depending on the design specifications.
data.target_sentence: In the case of pulsed LiDAR, the short-range dissipation factor may differ greatly from the actual value depending on the design specifications, and when using this error information, it is necessary to be sufficiently aware of it or to correct it.

data.source_sentence: 신호 왜곡 특성에 대하여 알아보자.
data.mt_sentence: Let's learn about the characteristics of signal distortion.
data.target_sentence: Let's look at the characteristics of signal distortion.

data.source_sentence: 미세먼지를 측정하는 주사형 미세먼지 라이다에는 레이저의 방향을 제어하기 위하여 구축된 카메라가 부착되어 있으며, 레이저에 의하여 생성된 카메라의 산란신호 영상을 분석하기 위해서는 카메라와 레이저의 정확한 상대적인 위치가 필요하다.
data.mt_sentence: A camera built to control the direction of the laser is attached to the scanning fine dust lidar that measures fine dust, and the exact relative position of the camera and the laser is required to analyze the scattered signal image of the camera generated by the laser.
data.target_sentence: A camera designed to control the direction of the laser is attached to the scanning fine dust radar that measures fine dust, and the exact relative position of the camera and the laser is required to analyze the image of the camera's scattering signal generated by the laser.

data.source_sentence: 카메라의 좌표계를 통하여 얻은 영상을 분석하여야 하기 때문에 카메라 좌표계를 중심으로 레이저의 위치를 표현할 수 있다.
data.mt_sentence: Since the image obtained through the coordinate system of the camera must be analyzed, the position of the laser can be expressed around the coordinate system of the camera.
data.target_sentence: Since the image obtained through the camera's coordinate system needs to be analyzed, the position of the laser can be expressed based on the camera's coordinate system.

data.source_sentence: 장착된 카메라와 레이저는 주사하여도 상대적으로 움직이지 않기 때문에 레이저의 좌표 및 방향 정보 (y0, z0, qL, fL)는 한번 구하여 지속적으로 사용이 가능하다.
data.mt_sentence: Since the mounted camera and laser do not move relatively even after scanning, the coordinates and direction information (y0, z0, qL, fL) of the laser can be obtained once and used continuously.
data.target_sentence: Since the mounted camera and laser do not move relatively even after scanning, the coordinates and direction information (y0, z0, qL, fL) of the laser can be obtained only once and can be used continuously.

data.source_sentence: 일반적으로 하나의 화소값의 FOVP는 카메라 센서(charge-coupled device, CCD)의 크기와 화소 수, 그리고 사용한 렌즈의 초점에 의하여 결정되기 때문에 구축된 라이다의 카메라 사양을 그대로 사용하거나 실측하여 사용할 수 있다.
data.mt_sentence: In general, since the FOVP of a single pixel value is determined by the size of a charge-coupled device (CCD) and the number of pixels, and the focus of a used lens, the camera specification of the built LIDAR may be used or measured.
data.target_sentence: In general, the FOVP of a single pixel value is determined by the size of the CCD (Charge-Coupled Device), the number of pixels, and the focus of the lens used, so use the built-in LIDAR's camera specifications or measure accurately.

data.source_sentence: 레이저의 위치 좌표 정보 (y0, z0)는 식 (1)에 의하여 구할 수 있다.
data.mt_sentence: The laser position coordinate information (y0, z0) can be obtained by Equation (1).
data.target_sentence: The laser position coordinate information (y0, z0) can be obtained as in Equation (1).

data.source_sentence: 원거리의 경우 삼각형의 특성상 가까운 거리를 사용하여 구하는 것이 좋으며, 다양한 거리의 물체를 이용한 계산으로 가중 평균을 취하는 것이 좋다.
data.mt_sentence: In the case of long distance, it is better to use the close distance due to the characteristics of the triangle, and it is better to take the weighted average by calculating using objects of various distances.
data.target_sentence: In case of long distance, it is better to use the close distance due to the characteristics of the triangle, and it is better to calculate the weighted average using objects of various distances.

data.source_sentence: 평균을 취하는 과정에서 먼 거리의 물체를 이용하여 구한 (y0i, z0i)는 낮은 가중치를 두고 더한다.
data.mt_sentence: In the process of taking the average, (y0i, z0i) obtained using a long distance object is added with a low weight.
data.target_sentence: In the process of taking the average, (y0i, z0i) obtained using a distant object is added with a low weight.

data.source_sentence: 그림 4는 주어진 (y0i, z0i)에 대하여 이론적으로 얻은 다양한거리에 있는 레이저 빔 산란체의 위치를 나타낸 것이다.
data.mt_sentence: Figure 4 shows the positions of the laser beam scatterers at various theoretical distances for a given (y0i, z0i).
data.target_sentence: Figure 4 shows the positions of the laser beam scatterers at various theoretical distances for a given (y0i, z0i).

data.source_sentence: 그림 4의 계산된 산란체의 화소 위치 중 가운데 부분의 삼각형은 레이저의 좌표를 완벽하게 찾았을 경우이고, 다른 삼각형은 레이저의 (y0, z0) 좌표를 찾지 못한 경우이다.
data.mt_sentence: Among the pixel positions of the calculated scatterers in Figure 4, the center triangle is the case where the laser coordinates are perfectly found, and the other triangle is the case where the laser coordinates (y0, z0) are not found.
data.target_sentence: Among the pixel positions of the scatterers calculated in Figure 4, the center triangle is the case where the laser coordinates are perfectly found, and the other triangle is the case where the laser coordinates (y0, z0) are not found.

data.source_sentence: 그림 4는 카메라의 상대적인 위치 y0, z0를 구하는 다른 방법을 제시한다.
data.mt_sentence: Figure 4 presents another method to obtain the relative positions y0 and z0 of the camera.
data.target_sentence: Figure 4 shows another way to get the relative positions y0 and z0 of the camera.

data.source_sentence: 카메라에 잡힌 산란체 영상의 중심점 값과 미지수 y0, z0를 임의로 다양하게 변화시키면서 계산한 중심점을 상호 비교하는 것이다.
data.mt_sentence: The center point value of the scatterer image captured by the camera and the center point calculated by changing the unknowns y0 and z0 arbitrarily and variously are mutually compared.
data.target_sentence: The center point calculated by varying the values of the central point of the scattering image taken by the camera and the unknowns y0 and z0 arbitrarily and variously is compared with each other.

data.source_sentence: 두 중심점의 위치가 일치할 때까지 미지수 y0, z0를 회귀적으로(iteratively) 변화시키면 된다.
data.mt_sentence: It is enough to change the unknowns y0 and z0 recursively until the positions of the two center points coincide.
data.target_sentence: It is sufficient to iteratively change the unknowns y0 and z0 until the positions of the two centroids coincide.

data.source_sentence: 실제 적용 시 알고 있는 거리의 물체로 레이저 빔을 조사하고 그로부터 y0, z0의 절댓값을 얻는다.
data.mt_sentence: In actual application, the laser beam is irradiated with an object at a known distance and absolute values of y0 and z0 are obtained therefrom.
data.target_sentence: In practical application, a laser beam is irradiated to an object at a known distance, and the absolute values of y0 and z0 are obtained.

data.source_sentence: 레이저의 위치벡터가 만드는 평면을 고려할 때 두 좌표계의 중심점과 임의의 산란체(T)는 하나의 평면에 존재하는 삼각형으로 정의되며 그림 5처럼 나타낼 수 있다.
data.mt_sentence: When considering the plane created by the position vector of the laser, the center point of the two coordinate systems and the arbitrary scatterer (T) are defined as a triangle existing in one plane and can be represented as shown in Figure 5.
data.target_sentence: Considering the plane generated by the position vector of the laser, the center point of the two coordinate systems and the arbitrary scatterer (T) are defined as a triangle existing in one plane and can be represented as shown in Figure 5.

data.source_sentence: 하나의 화소에 기여하는 산란체의 양은 거리와 각도에 따라 달라진다.
data.mt_sentence: The amount of scatterers contributing to one pixel varies with distance and angle.
data.target_sentence: The amount of scatterer contributing to a pixel depends on distance and angle.

data.source_sentence: 그림 4에서 보여준 산란체의 영상에서 하나의 화소값의 밝기는 산란체의 거리, 그 화소가 만드는 각도 등에 따라 달라진다.
data.mt_sentence: In the image of the scatterer shown in Figure 4, the brightness of one pixel value varies depending on the distance of the scatterer and the angle the pixel makes.
data.target_sentence: In the scatterer image in Figure 4, the brightness of one pixel value depends on the distance between the scatterers and the angle the pixels form.

data.source_sentence: 같은 밝기의 화소이더라도 이러한 효과를 고려해야만 산란체에서 카메라로 진행하면서 발생하는 소산(extinction)을 얻을 수 있다.
data.mt_sentence: Even for pixels of the same brightness, it is possible to obtain the extinction that occurs while proceeding from the scatterer to the camera only by considering this effect.
data.target_sentence: Even pixels of the same brightness can obtain extinction that occurs while proceeding from the scatterer to the camera only by considering this effect.

data.source_sentence: 그림 5에서 레이저로부터거리 RL만큼 떨어진 산란체(T)에서 산란된 빛과 그보다 약간 더 떨어진 RL + dRL 곳의 산란체 신호도 같은 화소에 입사된다는 의미이다.
data.mt_sentence: In Figure 5, it means that the scattered light from the scatterer (T) separated by a distance RL from the laser and the signal from the scatterer RL + dRL a little further away from the laser are also incident on the same pixel.
data.target_sentence: In Figure 5, it means that the light scattered from the scatterer (T) farther away from the laser by the distance (RL) and the signal from the scatterer (RL+dRL) a little further away from the laser also enter the same pixel.

data.source_sentence: 식 (3)은 삼각형 DTSCSL가 만족하는 삼각형의 사인 법칙에 의하여 얻은 같은 화소에 기여하는 산란체의 범위(기여도 = dRL)를 나타낸 것이다.
data.mt_sentence: Equation (3) shows the range of scatterers contributing to the same pixel (contribution = dRL) obtained by the sine rule of a triangle satisfied by the triangle DTSCSL.
data.target_sentence: Equation (3) shows the range of scatterers contributing to the same pixel (contribution = dRL) found by the law of sines of a triangle satisfied by the triangle DTSCSL.

data.source_sentence: 식에서 함수 F(X0, ΘC(RL), ΘL)는 하나의 화소에 기여하는 레이저 광 경로 상에 있는 입자들의 기여 길이에 해당한다.
data.mt_sentence: In the equation, the function F(X0, ΘC(RL), ΘL) corresponds to the contribution length of the particles in the laser light path contributing to one pixel.
data.target_sentence: In the equation, the function F(X0, ΘC(RL), ΘL) corresponds to the particle contribution length of the laser light path contributing to one pixel.

data.source_sentence: 일반적으로 레이저의 방향은 카메라의 광축과 일치시켜야 주사(scanning) 시 원하는 타겟 방향으로 정확히 레이저 빔을 보낼 수 있어 방향에 대한 측정 오차를 줄인다.
data.mt_sentence: In general, the direction of the laser must coincide with the optical axis of the camera so that the laser beam can be accurately sent to the desired target direction during scanning, thereby reducing the measurement error of the direction.
data.target_sentence: In general, the direction of the laser must coincide with the optical axis of the camera so that the laser beam can be accurately delivered to the desired target direction during scanning, thereby reducing the measurement error in the direction.

data.source_sentence: 그림 5에서 ΘL는 카메라의 광축과 일치하며, 90도로 가정하여도 무방하다.
data.mt_sentence: In Fig. 5, ΘL coincides with the optical axis of the camera, and it can be assumed to be 90 degrees.
data.target_sentence: In Figure 5, ΘL coincides with the optical axis of the camera and can be assumed to be 90 degrees.

data.source_sentence: 구축된 라이다의 카메라와 망원경의 광축은 약 X0 =0.5 m 분리되어 있기 때문에 상수이다.
data.mt_sentence: The optical axis of the built lidar's camera and telescope is constant because it is separated by about X0 = 0.5 m.
data.target_sentence: The optical axis of the built-in lidar camera and telescope is constant because it is about X0 = 0.5m apart.

data.source_sentence: 그림 6은 라이다의 환경에 맞도록 레이저의 방향(ΘL)과 거리(X0)를 일정하게 두고, 식 (3b)의 기여 길이 함수 F(X0, ΘC, ΘL)를 나타낸 것이다.
data.mt_sentence: Figure 6 shows the contribution length function F(X0, ΘC, ΘL) of Equation (3b) with the direction (ΘL) and distance (X0) of the laser constant to suit the environment of the lidar.
data.target_sentence: Figure 6 shows the contribution length function F(X0, ΘC, ΘL) in equation (3b) with the direction (ΘL) and distance (X0) of the laser constant suitable for the LIDAR environment.

data.source_sentence: 식에서 하나의 화소가 보는 시각은 레이저가 만드는 산란체의 일부분만 보는 것이고(그림 4), 레이저 빔의 진행 방향을 따라(dRL) 존재하는 산란체는 거리에 관계없이 같은 면적을 가 진다고 한다면 식 (4)가 만족된다.
data.mt_sentence: In the equation, the view of one pixel is only a part of the scattering body made by the laser (Fig. 4), and if the scattering body present along the direction of the laser beam (dRL) has the same area regardless of distance, Equation (4) is satisfied.
data.target_sentence: In the equation, the field of view of one pixel is only part of the scatterer produced by the laser (Fig. 4), and equation (4) is satisfied if the scatterers existing along the direction of the laser beam (dRL) have the same area regardless of distance.

data.source_sentence: 식에서 I0는 레이저가 발진되었을 때의 빛의 세기이다.
data.mt_sentence: In the equation, I0 is the intensity of light when the laser oscillates.
data.target_sentence: In the equation, I0 is the light intensity when the laser vibrates.

data.source_sentence: 이 과정은 식 (6)으로 표현할 수 있으며, 하나의 화소의 밝기는 각종 광학계의 투과 도와 CCD의 감도 등을 고려한 상수 C에 포함된다.
data.mt_sentence: This process can be expressed by Equation (6), and the brightness of one pixel is included in the constant C considering the transmittance of various optical systems and the sensitivity of the CCD.
data.target_sentence: This process can be expressed by Equation 6, and the brightness of one pixel is included in the constant C in consideration of the transmittance of various optical systems and the sensitivity of the CCD.

data.source_sentence: 같은 거리의 모든 레이저의 산란 신호를 합하여 표현한다면 식 (6)을 다르게 표현할 수 있으나, 본 연구에서는 하나의 화소 값을 이용하기 때문에 식 (6)과 실험적으로 구한 영상의 화소 값을 이용한다.
data.mt_sentence: Equation (6) can be expressed differently if the scattering signals of all lasers at the same distance are combined, but since this study uses one pixel value, the pixel value of the image experimentally obtained with Equation (6) is used.
data.target_sentence: Equation 6 can be expressed differently by summing the scattering signals of all lasers at the same distance. However, since one pixel value is used in this study, the pixel value of the image experimentally obtained by Equation 6 is used.

data.source_sentence: 식 (6)은 전통적인 라이다 방정식과 같은 꼴이며, 전통적인 라이다 방법으로 안정적인 해 a(R" "c)를 구할 수 있다.
data.mt_sentence: Equation (6) has the same form as the traditional lidar equation, and a stable solution a(R" "c) can be obtained by the traditional lidar method.
data.target_sentence: Equation (6) has the same form as the existing LiDAR equation, and a(R" "c) can be obtained by stabilizing it in the existing LiDAR method.

data.source_sentence: 본 연구에서는 근거리(수십 미터) 신호가 카메라의 CCD에 1:1로 상을 맺는 과정에서 발생하는 데이터는 무시하였다.

data.target_sentence: In this study, data generated in the process of short-distance (tens of meters) signals that form a 1:1 image on the CCD of the camera were ignored.

data.source_sentence: 카메라에 맺힌 산란 영상을 추출하기 위하여 밤 시간대에 레이저 다이오드를 대기 중으로 조사하고, 그 산란광을 영상으로 얻었다.
data.mt_sentence: In order to extract the scattered image formed by the camera, a laser diode was irradiated into the atmosphere at night time, and the scattered light was obtained as an image.
data.target_sentence: In order to extract the scattered image formed by the camera, the scattered light was obtained as an image by irradiating a laser diode into the atmosphere at night.

data.source_sentence: 이를 식 (4)–(6)에 적용하여 라이다 식을 얻고 그 특성을 분석하였다.
data.mt_sentence: By applying this to equations (4)–(6), the lidar equation was obtained and its characteristics were analyzed.
data.target_sentence: By applying this to equations (4) to (6), the lidar equation was obtained and the characteristics were analyzed.

data.source_sentence: 그림 7은 다이오드(연속광원)와 상용카메라를 이용하여 얻은 전형적인 산란체의 영상이다.
data.mt_sentence: Figure 7 is an image of a typical scatterer obtained using a diode (continuous light source) and a commercial camera.
data.target_sentence: Figure 7 is an image of a typical scatterer obtained using a diode (continuous light source) and a commercial camera.

data.source_sentence: 본 연구에서는 20 m 이상의 비교적 원거리 정보만 사용하도록 하였다.
data.mt_sentence: In this study, only relatively long-distance information of 20 m or more was used.
data.target_sentence: In this study, only relatively long-distance information of 20 m or more was used.

data.source_sentence: 산란체 영상의 중심선을 따라 각 화소의 산란체가 얼마의 거리에 있는지를 알기 위해서는 우선 레이저의 방향(qL, fL)과 레이저의 카메라에 대한 위치정보 X0 = (0, y0, z0)가 필요하다.
data.mt_sentence: In order to know how far the scatterers of each pixel are along the center line of the scatterer image, the laser direction (qL, fL) and positional information X0 = (0, y0, z0) of the laser camera are required.
data.target_sentence: In order to know how far apart the scatterers of each pixel are along the center line of the scatterer image, the laser direction (qL, fL) of the laser camera and positional information X0 = (0, y0, z0) are needed.

data.source_sentence: 화소의 FOV는 카메라의 FOV를 총 화소 수로 나눈 것이기 때문에 카메라의 사양을 통하여 알 수 있고, 측정을 통하여도 확인이 가능하다.
data.mt_sentence: Since the FOV of a pixel is the FOV of the camera divided by the total number of pixels, it can be known through the camera specifications and can also be confirmed through measurement.
data.target_sentence: A pixel's FOV is the camera's FOV divided by the total number of pixels, so it can be known from the camera specifications and can also be determined from measurements.

data.source_sentence: 본 연구에서는 건물과 산을 촬영하고 그 두 위치의 지도상에 나타낸 거리, 그리고 카메라와 물체까지의 거리를 이용하여 전체 카메라의 FOV를 찾고 이로부터 하나의 화소에 대한 화소각을 구하여 사용하였다.
data.mt_sentence: In this study, a building and a mountain were photographed, and the FOV of the entire camera was found using the distance shown on the map of the two locations and the distance between the camera and the object, and the pixel angle for one pixel was obtained from this.
data.target_sentence: In this study, a building and a mountain are photographed, and the distance indicated on the map of the two locations and the distance between the camera and the object are used. Based on this, the FOV of the entire camera was found, and the pixel angle for one pixel was obtained from it and used.

data.source_sentence: 이는 무한히 먼 거리에 있는 지향점의 방향이 카메라의 좌표와 일정 위치만큼 이동한 레이저 위치에서의 방향과 동일하기 때문이다.
data.mt_sentence: This is because the direction of the aiming point at an infinite distance is the same as the direction of the camera coordinates and the laser position moved by a certain position.
data.target_sentence: This is because the direction of the aiming point is the same as the direction of the camera coordinates at infinite distance and the laser position is moved by a certain position.

data.source_sentence: 이렇게 얻은 레이저의 방향과 임의의 위치정보를 이용하여 일정 간격만큼 이동시킨 레이저의 위치를 식 (2)를 이용해 결정할 수 있다.
data.mt_sentence: The direction of the laser obtained in this way and the position of the laser moved by a predetermined interval may be determined using Equation (2).

data.source_sentence: 계산된 지점을 그림 4에서 하나의 점으로 표시하였다.
